subject: Relationships
title: The Four Horsemen of Relationship Doom
description: One-minute skill: The Four Horsemen of Relationship Doom.

hook.text: John Gottman can predict divorce with 94% accuracy ‚Äî just by watching a couple argue for 15 minutes.

buildup.text: He identified four toxic patterns: criticism, contempt, defensiveness, and stonewalling.

discovery.text: Contempt is the deadliest. Eye-rolling and sarcasm erode respect faster than any other behavior.

twist.text: The antidote isn't avoiding conflict ‚Äî it's replacing contempt with appreciation and criticism with requests.

climax.text: Bad communication doesn't just end relationships. It poisons them slowly, one sneer at a time.

punchline.text: Contempt kills relationships faster than infidelity.

quiz.question: Which of the 'Four Horsemen' is the most destructive?
